statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: Cam Jackson scored 20 points and grabbed 10 rebounds and Wofford beat Furman 67-58 on Saturday night to end a three-game skid.
article.headline: Jackson's 20 leads Wofford in 67-58 win over Furman
article.linkText: Jackson's 20 leads Wofford in 67-58 win over Furman
article.story: SPARTANBURG, S.C. -- Cam Jackson scored 20 points and grabbed 10 rebounds and Wofford beat Furman 67-58 on Saturday night to end a three-game skid. Eric Garcia scored 14 points and made six assists, Fletcher Magee added 12 points, and the Terriers (7-11, 2/3 Southern) made 6 of 18 3-pointers and 13 of 19 free throws. Furman's Kris Acox tied it at 35 with a jumper, but Jackson hit a jumper, Garcia and Ryan Sawvell each added a 3-pointer, and the Terriers were up 50-44 with 8:08 left. Furman cut the deficit to two on a dunk by Acox, but Wofford led 57-48 after a 7-0 run in which Magee and Jaylen Allen hit 3s, then 67-56 with 27 seconds left after Garcia and Magee each made two free throws. Acox's putback dunk gave Furman a 25-23 lead with 51 seconds left in the first half, but Magee's jumper tied it at 25 at halftime. Devin Sibley scored 21 and Acox had 16 for Furman (10-8, 3-2).
